reviewText:
This is one of those old RPG's that you will either love or hate. It's kinda like trying to jump into something like Ragnarok Online in 2015. I played this way back in beta on game n game or something. Eventually played on OG Planet for a bit. The game is different now. Way more classes and characters. An entirely different, better, and longer tutorial. One of the cool things about the game is the extensive skill system and class switching on the fly.

If you can get past the interface, playing windowed, and overwhelming information dump at the start, you may find a new old game you enjoy. I should also mention the controls. They will take some getting used to. If you have played games like Diablo in the past it may not bother you. But to younger gamers it will seem really weird.

My general tip is to adjust your stats to the gear you are trying to equip. And for skills find a skill you want to aim for and right click it to see the skill tree. This will stop you from leveling a skill you might not need.

I may rewrite this review in the future because I have been awake for close to 24 hours so this probably sounds crazy.
voteText: 100 of 121 people (83%) found this review helpful 11 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Hello i have played a few mmo's so far, so i know a few things. This game is not for the casuals let's state that right now.
PROS

There's over 600 levels with a rebirthing system. You can use it to reset yourself back to level 1, this in turn gets you more stats and skill points.

Classes they have a some pretty cool classes, there aren't many games that offer some of the classes this game does.

Tamers/summoner's, this class is my favorite so far they can have two summons out as well as two pets. This game has the best pet system that i have found. As you level up, you can put skill points into your stats which upgrades your pets stats. You also get a skill, where you can ride one of your pets to increase your movement speed.

Stat points that's right this game has them. Most games are going complete casual, where you can't build your class how you want. As you level up you get stat points which you can put point's into to increase your characters proformance. You can pick a dps class and build tank, or you can sacrfice stats to increase your luck so you can find better gear, or increase your wisdom to increase exp ammounts.

Drop rates seem good, tons of stuff drops left and right.

CONS

graphic's are a bit out dated, mind you this game came out in 2003 from what i have found. If the gameplay is good the graphic's don't mean much to me.

Genderlock classes, this game did come out 2003. When this was acceptable, but it doesn't mean they can't change it now...

pay to win cash shop, yes you can pay for buff's the costumes you can buy increase stats a bit. Sadly this i can't give them a pass on this. It's an out dated system that shouldn't exist, league of legend/dota showed, you can survive without a pay to win cash shop. So why are they doing this? If anything there elimanting more people, because of the unfair advantages.

Clunky movement, and no v-sync option. This game has some pretty bad movement, at times you will seem to get stuck on nothing. Also the graphic option's are very limited, i can't even put on v-sync so i get screen tearing. I had to use nvidia control panel to do it, i still get screen tearing tho.

CONCLUSION.

Should you play redstone? It depends on if you like old school games, where they gave you freedom of choice. If you grew up in this time of gaming, where bad movement/graphics/pay to win cash shops was a thing then you found a pretty nice game.

However if you never played very many old games, nor grew up in the time i doubt you will like it. There's a lot of turn offs to the modern gamer, but it still doesn't mean you can't try. I say try the game, who knows you may like it. After all it is a free game, what do you have to lose?

Pretty much if you can sit down right now and play the elder scrolls 3 morrowind/diablo 2 and like it, this game should feel right at home with you. If you sit down and you don't like morrowind/diablo 2 there's no hope for you liking this game.

reviewText: One of the best MMORPG games, tight knit community, thousands of hours of gameplay, extremely well balanced and team oriented guild versus guild PvP system, over 600 unique items and infinite amount of different skill builds. Red Stone is set in a open world full of adventure, quests, hunting grounds full of monsters and mystery.\n\n- Nova | 8000+ hours played | http://priinya.blogspot.com/

reviewText:
I played this back in the day, ended up reaching top guild with my friends way back when , i even remember the GM Manwee was a cool guy i wish i still had those screenshots but this game was good for a long while untill you hit the level of 115 and had only one place to grind, but so did everyone else.. so everyone had to grind there making it very slow and very difficult to even level after that point and it took hours to level up. it was a very tedious grind and very tedios to find gear as gear dropped more if you had more luck but if you spammed luck you had to rely on others for killing things.
the Guild pvp means that the top guild stays top since they get more perks and bonus's and so on so forth meaning if you are a no name guild your guild hall and such looks like trash and slowly looks better as you move up. but if the big guilds hold the only rank 1 spot the 3 rank 2 spots the 5 rank 3 spots the 10 rank 4 spots and the 20 rank 5 spots. u really dont get anywhere and no guild can progress equally. the strong stay strong the weak stay weak and... guilds have limits on how many people can be in it . AND it caps so you cant just all join a strong guild..

aswell if you had a old account the website cannot find your old login id meaning you lost everything when they changed over so anything you used to have is gone now.


all in all this game is only good if you like excessively hard grinds. without much reward the game is fun in its own right and i would almost play it for nostalgic reasons but i will pass and keep it where it belongs in the past, some games die with time its a rite of time and how it goes, not all games are classics that carry over through time and remain good forever. and this one i will keep in my little area for nostalgic memorys and i will not reccomend this to others it just isnt worth the time in this day and age... and trust me it hurts a bit to say it about a game i spent countless hours on but its the truth

reviewText:
The Red Stone Adventure, feat The Slothinator.

So I made a deal with a friend to play all free to play games, so we have started with this one.
Wish me luck

Pros: Free to play.
Lots of characters, you can live your fantasy of being a princess and or a maid.
Very fun and funny with friends, if you take the ♥♥♥♥ with it.
Quite a bit of content. And loot.

Cons:The registration is confusing as balls, it says to put down your email, but if you put a valid email down, it doesn't work. So you have to do your username with a @gmail.com or one of the other choices so you can log-in.
Absolutely no customization of characters.
Menus are very amateur in design.
Controls very clunky and requires you to hold down to the left mouse to pick up items, and or attack monsters.
Controls are explained well. Sure they have it on the steam page to show you what to do. But they don't really explain it.
Quests are hard to understand, and there are random numbers and characters in the description.
Map is really bad and you can't understand it from the beginning, but you will after lots of research.
Graphics were okay, not something to write home about.

Reccomended if you want to just ♥♥♥♥ about.
Other than that, there is no meat to keep you around really.

reviewText:
A 2.5d MMORPG unlike any other.
This game has interactive Game Masters, a plethora of unique classes, and an endless amount of content to explore.
Reaching all the way up to level 999, the possibilities for playstyles within just one class are nearly limitless.
If you're looking for a great game with low computer requirements, this may be the game for you.
It plays similar to ARPGs like Diablo in the sense that you move via mouse clicks, instead of the popular WASD fashion.

Players can join guilds, form parties, and explore content together or alone.

Overall, this game has a solid 8.75 from me, only losing points due to the somewhat poor translations on things. Definitely pick this game up and at least give it a try.

The only other qualm aside from translations that I have, is that after a certain point, it tends to require a bit of money to level efficiently.(Buying a Portal Sphere, often referred to as 'Prem'.)

reviewText: While the game may seem a tad out dated hoenstly i have yet to find a game that covers so much as RedStone Online! The classes Branch off from your typical Archer(Range) Warrior(Melee) and Mage(Caster) with the Transformation system. There are so many routes a  player can take with both his Stats and Skills and some fun combo's that others would not have thought of. Another Plus is it's not your typical Pay2Win game as there have been several casual players who obtained a rather high level without ever spending a dime. With Wisdom Bonus (a Stat), Berries (an item thats available to all players) Guild Dungeons and Secrect Dungeons, Red Stone Detective (Exp Bonus while in party) its easy to level if you stick it out. Finally the Item hunting aspect is rather nifty. You chance to get some great items while random can be increased with a stat (Luck) and rather than being a useless" item hunter the stat will actually help you deal more damage by way of crits. I could go on all day about RedStone its just a great game!"

reviewText:
I played this game for less than 5 minutes and I had a hard time tolerating it enough test much of anything after you make it out of the building you are put in after the first tutorial screen.

First and foremost there is no way to pick a decent resolution.  What the hell, is this game made in the 1990's?  Did the devs think this was a good idea?  Absolutely stupid idea now allowing for a spectrum of different resolutions to pick from.  It's so atrocious you actually have to check a box to put it in 1024x768.

Second thing right off, the graphics.  Now I don't expect it to be top-notch graphics or anything but this is just outright lazy.  No real effort was put into the graphics and the end result is bad.  The animations don't look all that appealing either and when you are moving your character she slides all over the screen like she/he's drunk.  Furthermore there is a slight lag to the animations and lack any smoothing making them out of place to the rest of the graphics.  Spell effects and the like aren't too bad but again they are boring and unappealing to the eye.

Pathing.  There is no pathing that I can see in this game.  Play Baldur's gate and then play this game and you will know what I mean.

Classes.  These are locked to specific genders and I absolutely HATE games that disallow you to customize your sex to a class.  Typical korean MMO ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.  While I only tried one class as of writing this, it's not worth noting anything of significance.

Combat.  Nothing specially really.  You click you swing your weapon automatically things die.  It's very unappealing to look at and the tedium of watching it makes me wish want to watch a movie or something while engaging in combat.  The leveling system is weird as well.  I can't tell what they are trying to do with it to be honest.  I'll try to explain as best I can with the limited knowledge I have thus far:

I ran up to a scarecrown in this first town I was thrown into.  As I'm beating on it, I'm getting experience?  After about 30 seconds of beating on mr scarecrow I'm what appears to be level 3.  Now I can't exactly tell if this is my overall level, if I'm leveling up a weapon skill but then again like most korean mmo's you don't have freedom to pick whatever weapon you wish, you are forced to a weapon based on your class, another reason why the classes in this game outright suck balls.  After I managed to hit level 3 it stopped.  I haven't at this point managed to come across any enemies so I don't know if there is more to the level system than this but from what I gather it's nothing worth getting all giddy about.  I opened up the skills screen and while there are plenty of skills, 2 tabs for the tamer class, the system itself is rather confusing.  I think you get skill points based on lord knows what and can level them up.

Music and sound.  Horrible to say the least.  The music is what you expect from a boring cliche` f2p korean mmo.  The real garbage is the sound effects.  I could probably find better sound effects from a royalty free website than whatever samples they bothered to use.  They actually ended up hurting my ears from combat on the scarecrow I mentioned earlier.

I've had enough of this game I can't stomach playing it any longer.  I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone at all.  You can find way better f2p games to play if that really is your fancy.  I mean for an f2p mmo, this game is at best something to do if you have absolutely nothing to do and even then it doesn't grab my attention enough to warrant playing more than a few minutes without wanting to play something else of quality.  I've played half-♥♥♥♥♥ korean mmo's that were far better than this.  I feel ashamed I wasted the time I have on this to even bother writing a review.  If you like less than mediocre 1990'esque garbage mmo's this one is RIGHT up your alley.

reviewText: Although I am not recommending this game, I do recommend it for certain people.  If you have lousy internet speed, a slow rig, and/or you can't afford better hack and slash iso RPGs then i recommend this game for you.\nThis game seems like a browser game.  It has to be played windowed, the character control is inaccurate, and the graphics aren't so hot.  It has unprecedented character growth (over level 600) and each character essentially has 2 classes.  The biggest problem is how poor the pathing is.  My pet can't run around a bush.  I tell him to attack and he stands there.  I have to run ahead 50 yards for him to finally advance.  The obstacles are a real issue when targeting as well.  An enemy that is 20% covered by a bush you can't hit, you don't have line of sight.  In order to hit him you have to run all the way to the other side of the bush, even from the side it still won't let you attack.  No, I didn't play the game very long.  When you run into these issues and you have far better and smoother iso RPGs to play then there is no reason to continue with this.  I probably would have played it back in 2003, when it came out.  Innexcusable that such flaws are still in the game.

reviewText: Going to be brutally honest here. Took me an HOUR just to create an account. This shouldn't be an issue.... we have a Steam account already going, why do we have to have another account just to play? It should just use our already existing account info since the Steam version is seperate anyway. After finally taking the long route and getting tired of the slow and troublesomeness of the account creation via the ingame Steam web browser, I copy/pasted the web link into my usual browser to do it in a matter of seconds. After this, I was half tempted to not bother, was already irritated at it. But I created a character anyway to try it out. Not what I wanted nor expected. Clunky interface and controls, videos and such make it look like it should play more like a Diablo clone, plays more like a typical MMORPG. Now I am a big MMORPG player so this could have turned out ok in the end. But no.... gets worse. Even for a seasoned MMORPG player like myself, there was little to no help with what you should be doing. The in game help and guides and quest system leave much to be desired. I spent more time trying to find quests than I do in any other game. I want the quests themselves to take longer than finding them in the first place. After awhile I just was so bored I swear I saw the reaper peaking in the window to see if my soul was ready for the taking.\nIf you can get past the games difficulty to learn and adjust to, I am sure it could be a real gem with all the class and skill potential I saw. But if you are a jump in and pick it up in less than an hour person or want something easy to learn, this is not for you.\nWould let it suck my soul again! 10/10

reviewText:
Okay probably the first and last time I comment on a game.... how ever I've been playing this game for years since the US beta back when you could kill a chicken and level up to 20.  I was there during the power-leveling nerf and before any new classes were added.

I've always found this game horrible, it's grindy mind-numbing, the graphic horrid (though not the worst for it's time) rejoiced every time it died and cried every time it was revived though the necromantic power of a new company... every time drawing me into it's clutches time and time again...  I finally thought I was free of it, gone it was once again never to be seen. no mention of it on any site or forms.

Then Steam came along and revived it and here I am once again playing it despite hoping to never see it again, the game that never wants to die,  way beyond it's years and nothing more than a zombie of it's former self.

P.S. make sure you talk to the Associates located conveniently around the town for your overpowered buffs and use the compass to get back to town (and to them for rebuffs) the game is a lot less grindy with those and ask experanced players where the best leveling spots are.

reviewText:
Pros :
Many classes to suit your taste and style .
Whatever class you pick , you will aways be able to switch to his counterpart , meaning that at higher levels you won't need to make a new character to try out your other character class .
Unique and addicting item drop system with many prefix/suffix'es and entirely Unique items that are extreamly rare .
Supports solo or party play , depending on your style .
Guild vs Guild (And guild ranks/levels)
Does not require any $$$ to progress (Tho there are certain spots only available to people with premium).
Not pay 2 win yet .
Many more hidden surprises once you play it !
Cons :
If you judge the game by the graphics , this one isn't for you .
Can feel clunky and unresposive at times , untill you get used to it .
Not all classes are 100% balanced according to the others, but it can be achieved with some tweaks .
Can be very grindy and repetetive sometimes (I ussualy take a break) .
Extreamly adicting !

it reminds me of the period that i played DIABLO1.

Well i recommend! 8/10

reviewText:
It's probably a must play if u are an ex RS player for nostalgic feel. (like me)
But if you are a new player... read on.

The good things, many classes to choose from. Rather than your usual generic classes.
Many different equipments or unique gears.
Can customise your stats.

The bad
Clumsy movement, hard to pick items or coins at times, there is an obstacle in your way, laggy client at times. Outdated graphics.


Lame quests that requires you to go to point A to B, go back to A and asked you to go back to B to kill or get quest item again.
(But ya, if you are not a quest person, you can ignore this.)

Bugs not fix, for weeks to months despite reported to them.

The ingame market that players are selling is quite expensive and overpriced.
I am pretty sure, most of the equipments are not so expensive in previous servers.

So if you are a new player, pray hard that u meet someone good enough to help you with gears, or good luck hunting on your own.

reviewText:
Alright, so I've read most of the reviews and I can tell you guys a few thing:

Most of the this game is great" are from players who've been playing this game for years.

Cons:

Poorly translated. (Though this can easily be worked around/ worked with. And is sometimes comical
"it is cool time" instead of this spell is on cooldown)

This game is unfriendly to new players. (Sure people will be NICE to you and you'll get power leveled some but people will ditch you randomly or stop after a few minutes of power leveling)

The game is mostly lonely until you reach the levels that most of the community is at. (The game really doesn't start being fun until this point)

Leveling to 100 is probably the most boring part but after you get 100 more options for leveling / gear / skills open up and the game becomes more fun. (At current xp rates and playing solo it'll take ~20-30 hours of actual game time to get level 100 -note- this does not include being power leveled by friends/guilds/nice players)

Xp rates are VERY VERY LOW (You can buy xp boosts with real money and you also get "berries" which are similar to rested experience in other MMOs but cost 500
date:
000 in-game gold to aquire as well as HOURS of logged out time)

Questing is NOT the most efficient way to level...in fact it's not recommended (grinding is really the only way to level)

Requires a lot of time
recommended:
THIS IS NOT A CASUAL GAME.

Pros:

Near infinite skill combinations.

Whimsical classes / skills. (I mean being a Princess who can transform into a rolling log to crush her enemies or getting really fat and squishing them under her butt is pretty whimsical)

Leveling up / gearing up makes you feel powerful. (Starting off doing 1-2 dmg then doing 200-1000 then end levels 20
hoursPlayed:
000 per hit makes you feel strong / accomplished)

Stable economy for trading (prices are pretty much set in stone and fluxuate slowly)

PvP is fun and different

Guilds add a sense of community

Rewarding if you spend your time correctly. (Gaining levels actually mean something in a game with 999 levels. A level 600 and 700 are two different worlds.)

The people on this game are nice. (Not all
voteText:
but most)



All in all
helpfulPercent: this game is fun. I've played it for years so I know what to do when making a new character / starting over.\n\nIt's not new player friendly
votesHelpful:
but if you are a new player read blogs people have posted and it'll help you the best it can.

-If you try this game and really bite down and do your best you won't regret it-

If you sink time into this game it will be very rewarding."

reviewText: So i a returning player (played it when it was host by OGP) i didnt really get far then (270) as i didnt know the correct method to level. The correct method is POWER LEVELING, yes powerleveling.... When this came out on steam i was excited\nand try it out again but i thought, i was like Hey
date: it wasnt a bad game the grind was just too hard and the class i was playing(warrior) was total trash according to what every high level was saying" so this time when it came out on steam i pick the other sub class (Squire) which was alot stronger and tanky and better than warrior in every other way. I told you that because it one of the stuff i wanna bring up with the negative experience i had.\n\n- Premium  ~ Renting a Portal Sphere/Gate Sphere makes you a premium player giving you 100% added exp from monsters that are killed
recommended: Access to Premium dungeon/zone which give another 100% added exp bonus
hoursPlayed: 2 spot that can be saved anywhere and teleported to at anything time. A unlimited mount(mount are only aquired by having sphere or event that give a 1 time use one) and last unlimited return home scroll. If you are trying to reach far/late into the game this item is a must have or you will need to play double the time just to catch up.\n\n- POWER LEVELING  ~Im sure you all know what power leveling is but for those who doesnt its when a stronger or higher level person joins your party and kill high level mobs and you get massive amount of exp from it. So guys i got level 400+ in about a month(w/ sphere) and i got power leveled 95% of the way
voteText: i literally didnt have to do anything because of it
helpfulPercent: even if i tried i wasnt strong enough to even put a dent in the monster. This power leveling goes from level 1-460 from what i heard.\n\n- Unbalanced Classes  ~ An example here is how the warrior is outclasses in every way to his counter part(Squire) Better damage and defense skill. Tamers hitting 20k damage cap 2x/sec with each pet(2 max) at level 300 possible to aquire this by being butt naked or having the best gears doesnt matter much for tamers
votesHelpful: While as a level 300 squire is hit for 700s and my strongest skill doing 6k every second. Dps was 7-8k while tamers were 80k+. This also makes them great power leveler

Sorry bout this awful review of me just ranting about stuff

reviewText:
I think it's a good game, but this is the kind of game that is for specific kind of players, unfortunately most people won't like it, because it's outdated. I played for at least 20 hours, and i think i'll spend more time with this game. I know that the gameplay isn't friendly and has problems, the graphics are outdated compared to actual games and at the start of the game it seems that there isn´t a story, maybe some years ago it would have been a very popular game where you could spend your time with friends, but now, there are a lot of games more atractive than this.

Now there are some things that you need to know if you are planning to play despite everything:

1. This game is from 2004, so it´s old, don´t expect amazing graphics or big updates, from time to time the devs do some maintenance and small updates.
2. If you like games where you need to grind like a maniac you'll love it.
3. Some people experience a problem when they try to login the first time, but don't let this discourage if you have this problem. My friend closed and re-entered to the game and he could log in. You can find a solution if you try.
3. There're lot of things when you start to play and maybe you'll get lost, but don't think there isn't a tutorial. The problem is that you need to speak to every NPC in the town to know about the mechanics of the game and it's very tedious for some people.
4. The menu is not friendly, for example you can put in fullscreen the game (it's in window mode for default),but you need to do before start the game in the options of the launcher..

In conclusion, if you like these kind of korean ♥♥♥♥♥♥mes and the graphics won't bother you so much, you´ll like it.
In other case, just don't trouble yourself; please don't get mad at this game because you don't like it and go search for other games ;)

5/10

column22: then Mercs and eventually some desert with spiders which i had only dreamed to become strong enough to kill(Also messing around with quests and hoarding every title).\n\nI really missed how wonderful of a community old RS had before it died
column23: and the memories of party synergy and incredible teamwork. Good ol' memories of  Red Thieves(sometimes accidently dying and getting upset from getting healed).  GvGs were fun back then too
column25: pretty rare to find anyone toxic after a gvg dunno how it is now. Since back then everyone pretty much knew everyone past a certain level.\n\nI was hoping Redstone2(RS2) would have the same feel of the first one but they completely failed and ripped off Perfect world / WoW
column26:
so that sucks.

We need more class based-party based- dungeon/huge mob train friendly MMORPGS like Redstone!

I have yet to play a game that was even remotely close to Redstone that offered the same teamwork/party/class based/huge mob trains/friendly community feel.

Maybe i'll play again sometime soon
column27:
last time i had horrible issues trying to even connect to the game. EXTREMELY boring playing alone.

Any vets from old RS feel free to add me on steam. I'm sure anyone i knew is 20-30+ now since they were all older than me.

P.s Looking for the person who took the name "Dove". Just curious to see if you knew the original.


TL;DR I extremely miss the old fantastic social community/teamwork of Redstone
column28: current RS is a maze for new players and sadly nothing like before from my most recent experience. Walking sucks less with new buff NPC."
